intro: Ceropegia caffrorum, commonly known as the Cape ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are often visited by specific pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Ceropegia caffrorum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
